DataElement.preferredName: 10-2 Visual Field Testing Assessment Normal Abnormal Not Obtained Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates if the visual field assessment that tests the central 10 degrees, creating 68 points with 2 degrees between points is normal or abnormal or not obtained. It is most often used on patients with conditions that affect central vision (e.g., macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy) or when only a small amount of central vision remains (e.g., end-stage glaucoma).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test for visual field defects that tests the central 10 degrees, creating 68 points with 2 degrees between points. It is most often used on patients with conditions that affect central vision (e.g., macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy) or when only a small amount of central vision remains (e.g., end-stage glaucoma)._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The value domain for Normal, abnormal, not obtained, and other summary indicators.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):Deviating from the norm.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:To come into possession of something. (Concept includes term form "Obtained"):An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To come into possession of something.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
